column4: I have an XP drive with a US adapter that I just plugged into my Feisty.. I thought it would be a plug n play... nothing happened... "sudo fdisk -l" doesn't show the new device either... what can I do?
us adater = USB adapter **
please help with mounting an external usb drive [ NTFS ]
what is the filesystem on the drive?
NTFS.. it is my friends XP drive whose laptop died... trying to mount it here and burn some files on a CD
you probably tried mount -t ntfs /some/dir rite?
you probably tried mount -t ntfs /dev/sdd1 /some/dir rite?
I was trying sudo mount /dev/sdd -t ntfs-3g /mnt
have you tried sdd1?
just tried it.. no luck there
if it's a harddrive you may have better luck popin it in as a slave via ide
you can disable UAC :)
did your friend have encryption enabled?
Nope...:)
if it IS uac causing problems you can go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System and change the key EnableLUA to 0
doesn't sound like UAC though

yeah.. I did try and disable UAC, and vista was complaining about not having permissions and me needing to change ownership, when I tried to change ownership, it was saying permission denied/... pretty dumb stuff.. I thought i could just mount it under ubuntu and copy her files
I take it you are using a laptop? can't install the drive as a slave on the IDE?
seems like any time you try to help someone, their stuff doesn't act like it should
looks like the drive is corrupt. not dead just juggled some :)
you could try ntfs-dos boot disk and chkdsk. ntfs-dos should have better luck finding the drive
if it's worth putting a couple dollars into getting the data I would look at SpinRite 6
Thanks
SpinRite'l cure what ales yah
